intro: Torreya grandis var. jiulongshanensis, commonly known as the Jiulongshan torreya, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Taxaceae, which includes yews and other coniferous plants. This variant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and distinctive cone structures that mature to a reddish-brown color. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
